name: Matters of the State
description: The administration of Devlet-i Aliyye-i Osmâniyye is a serious task that must be undertaken with all the seriousness it demands.

name: Political Interests
description: The Ottoman Constitution states that the Ottoman Houses of Parliament will be opened by an official ceremony every year, where the Sultan will deliver an Imperial Address. In the turbulent times we are facing, we need the guidance of a 'Nutk-ı Hümayun' more than ever!

name: Dissolve the Parliament
description: The current Parliamentary system and political bickering is taking away our ability to make important decisions in a timely manner. We must follow the footsteps of the Great Sultan Abdülhamid Khan II to dismantle this House of Conspiracy.

name: Eliminate All Opposition
description: We did not find our people on the streets. We cannot allow these 'opposition' groups to poison their minds with Western propaganda.

name: Enforce Autocracy
description: By unifying all powers of the state in the hands of a capable monarch, we will be able to survive the great calamities of our time.

name: Support the Parliament
description: The Houses of Parliament give legitimacy to our rule, and provide valuable counsel in policymaking. We must celebrate and strengthen our democratic tradition, for it constantly blows new life to the Ottoman Empire.

name: Write New Constitution
description: The Ottoman Constitution of 1876, translated directly from the French Constitution and announced under foreign pressure, is the product of a bygone era. Let us write it anew to face the challenges of this century!

name: Enforce the Rule of Law
description: Only by carefully setting up a system of checks and balances between the executive, legislative and judicial branches can we weather the storms of the coming years.

name: Fight Corruption
description: It has become clear that Ottoman Empire will not be cured of its illness as long as corruption lives on. Sooner or later, one of them must destroy the other.

name: Eliminate Military Factions
description: There exist factions within our military that hold loyalties other than to the Sultan. These ideological, nationalistic, and even religious cliques loyal to various hidden societies will be the death of our armed forces if something isn't done.

name: Rebuild Ottoman Intelligence
description: Our old agencies, the Yıldız Organisation and Special Organisation of the CUP have degenerated into corrupt paramilitary organisations more concerned with backstabbing each other than gathering foreign intelligence. This must be corrected.

name: Mecidian Reforms
description: Following in the footsteps of his father, our Sultan Abdülmecid II began setting up a framework for further reformation of his Empire. Whether it will be successful is another question...

name: Legal Reforms
description: Our legal code Mecelle is always in the process of improvement. We could focus additional efforts to this area of reform to ensure that justice is always served quickly and decisively.

name: Judicial Reforms
description: The independence of our judges safeguards every person's right to have their case decided solely on the basis of law, evidence and facts, without any improper influence. A well-functioning judiciary is therefore an essential requirement for fair and consistent administration of justice.

name: Administrative Reforms
description: It is no secret that our methods of administration are behind the times. We must take steps to ensure better administration by reassessing the wages of civil servants, switching to the metric system and adopting the Standard Ottoman script as proposed by our academic institutions.

name: Bureaucratic Reforms
description: Ottoman Bureaucracy is a place where hopes and dreams go to die. We cannot hope to rejuvenate the Empire without fixing our corrupt and sluggish bureaucracy.

name: Education Reforms
description: Reforming the education system on all levels, from the elementary schools to universities and traditional religious institutions, will help our nation regain its strength.

name: Expand the Universities
description: Our industrial expansion and other recent advances might allow us to conduct more R&D in parallel. By providing more funding to our major universities we might be able to speed up Ottoman technological progress.

name: Hayreddin Pasha Faculty of Research
description: The rapid industrialisation of our nation has opened up new opportunities in R&D that we should pursue. We have the unique opportunity of establishing the Çandarlı Kara Halil Hayreddin Paşa Faculty of Research in Bursa, to be dedicated solely to advanced theoretical research.

name: Foreign Affairs
description: Even if our hands are bound by the troubles at home, we still have a few cards to play in the international arena...

name: The Ottoman Caliph
description: Ottoman Sultan is the Rightful Caliph of all Muslims. By actively pursuing bilateral relations with other Muslim nations, we should be able to improve our legitimacy across the world.

name: OPDA Negotiations
description: When the Ottoman Treasury ran dry in 1881, we weren't allowed to default on our debts. Instead, the European Great Powers decided they would collect taxes on our behalf to extract their payments. This dire state of affairs has gone on for too long...

name: Reassert Rule over Yemen
description: Endless revolts in the Yemen Vilayet had forced the Ottoman Empire to enter negotiations with the Zaydi many years ago. We have been isolated from our former Vilayet since the Weltkrieg, but the situation in Arabia is rapidly changing...

name: Turkic Diplomacy
description: Now that we are free to pursue our own path in foreign matters, we should reach out to the Turkic peoples around us. We are only seeking our birthright, our legacy. And we will take it...

name: Liberate Batumi
description: Godless socialists have taken over yet another nation and are now in control of our old territories around Batumi. With the German giant looking away, now is the time to restore the rule of the Sultan

name: Economic Initiatives
description: A few centuries ago, the Ottoman Empire had one of the largest economies in the world. This is no longer the case, as the Westerners discovered better ways of manufacturing while our production technology stagnated. We must make coordinated efforts to remedy this.

name: Agricultural Investments
description: The agricultural methods utilised by our peasants are still the same old techniques used by farmers since the Stone Age. Without modern agricultural techniques, we cannot hope to match the efficiency of western agriculture.

name: Schools of Agriculture
description: We can speed up the spread of new farming technologies by establishing schools of agriculture in all corners of our Empire.

name: Land Reforms
description: An unpopular measure, but a necessary one nonetheless. We must redistribute the farmlands in our Empire. The ancient Tımar system has degenerated badly, and needs to be replaced by scientific allocation of farming lands to people capable of actually farming it.

name: Mechanised Agriculture
description: Tractors are a rare sight in the Ottoman Empire, as these imported vehicles are simply too expensive for the average peasant. The need for spare parts and advanced repairs complicates things further. We must expand our national tractor industry so we can achieve our own agricultural revolution!

name: Industrial Investments
description: With iron will and a relentless work ethic, we can focus all our efforts on industrialising our great empire.

name: Anatolian Factories
description: While our major cities are important centres of production with modern civilian factories, Anatolia is curiously devoid of such facilities. We must ensure the economic participation of the entire Ottoman nation in our successful revival.

name: Encourage Construction Industry
description: Civilian industrial capacity must not be underestimated even when war looms over the world.

name: Expand Military Industries
description: Trying to adapt civilian factories to produce military equipment is inefficient. We should focus on building factories for military use.

name: Expand the Steel Industry
description: We have the coal and iron. Now we have the funding. Building a large steelworks complex in Karabük will provide the country with the heavy steel plating necessary for modern weapons.

name: Expand the Oil Industry
description: The oil fields in Kirkuk provide a substantial income for our Empire, and yet we suspect there may be other oil deposits in our Arab Vilayets. We should focus our efforts on finding and developing our oil fields.

name: Trade Expansion
description: Our rapid industrialisation will enable us to claim our place in the world markets. We should endeavour to support our businessmen in seeking trade opportunities across the world.

name: Infrastructure Investments
description: Connecting our population centres by railroads and autobahns will improve their economic participation and lower costs significantly.

name: Expand Anatolian Railroads
description: A country without proper infrastructure cannot pursue advanced projects or constructions. We must connect the interior of Anatolia with the rest of our Empire.

name: Expand Syrian Railroads
description: Extending our infrastructure further into Syria will enable the transports and communications necessary for keeping our Arab subjects under control.

name: Expand the Baghdad Railroad
description: The famous Baghdad Railroad has long been completed by German assistance, but we can still improve it further.

name: The Ottoman Army
description: Ottoman Army is the heart of the Turkish nation. We must seek to strengthen and support it against our numerous enemies, for the survival of our State depends on the Ever-Triumphant Horde.

name: Inspectorate of Army Modernisation
description: Mauser rifles and bayonets proved effective in the Weltkrieg, but the battlefield is changing. The large gap between enemy technologies and our equipment is ever-expanding, and we must expend considerable effort if we want our army to retain its might.

name: Equipment Effort
description: The limits for what equipment can be carried by infantry are constantly being pushed. We will focus on giving our troops the best tools available.

name: Modern Equipment
description: We will continue our efforts to ensure our infantry and support troops are armed with the best possible equipment of our time.

name: Artillery Effort
description: Artillery is crucial for the support of any forward movement by our infantry. As the grandsons of Mehmed II, we must expand research into ballistics and larger barrel guns.

name: Military Electronics
description: It is tempting to expend all extra resources into developing tanks and planes, but the secret to winning wars lies in whole new fields of science like electronics and computers.

name: Motorisation Effort
description: Mobility and protection are crucial to get infantry into and out of the field safely. Focusing on these developments will allow us to take action quickly.

name: Armour Effort
description: Tanks have come a long way from the sluggish beasts of the last war. Our research and training cannot fall behind that of other Great Powers. The Ottoman Empire must develop its own armoured vehicles.

name: Directorate of Military Factories
description: We must reorganise our military production facilities into a proper network of organised factories. Establishing the Askeri Fabrikalar Umum Müdürlüğü will ensure that our troops are constantly sent new equipment.

name: Training and Doctrine Schools Command
description: The military doctrines that defined ground combat in the Weltkrieg are outdated. We must put our greatest minds to the task of shaping the military thought of tomorrow.

name: Doctrine Studies
description: The battlefield has changed not just in the interbellum years, but over the course of recent conflicts. We must continuously reevaluate our doctrines to reflect this.

name: Army Engineer Schools
description: The Army Engineer Schools will shoulder the burden of building the foundation for many future military projects.

name: Special Forces Schools
description: We have need of elite forces; mountain troops and marine infantry should be our priority.

name: Reorganise Army Structure
description: The bitter lessons of our failed mobilisation efforts in the Weltkrieg are still fresh in memory. We must rebuild our conscription infrastructure and prepare realistic mobilisation timetables if we want to avoid the mistakes of the Weltkrieg.

name: Reform the Gendarmerie
description: The Ottoman Gendarmerie is a rural police force nearly a hundred years old, and yet it is too unorganised and under-equipped to fulfil even its basics duties. Channelling more officers and funding into the Gendarmerie Command should greatly improve their capabilities.

name: Form Desert Forces
description: With our few resources and desert landscapes, we have to find a smart way of turning our weakness into an advantage. Deployment of organised Imperial Camel Regiments is the best way to do this. Camels need very little water, are adapted to the terrain and don't require any oil, giving them more flexibility than armoured vehicles. They will also give us an edge over the nomadic tribes of Arabia!

name: Army Aviation Command
description: Nowhere is technological advances more rapid than in aerial warfare. Aviation is a field any modern nation must master.

name: Build More Airbases
description: Time has come to expand our Air Force! Plans have already been made to start construction of new Air Bases to support a big increase in both personnel and aircraft.

name: Air Warfare Academy
description: Further advances in aviation will be necessary to integrate our air force well with other branches of the military. We must expand the Yeşilköy Tayyare Mektebi into a modern academy that provides technical and tactical knowledge to our pilots.

name: Establish Aircraft Industry
description: Further developments in aircraft manufacturing capabilities will be necessary if we are to build a strong air force.

name: Fighter Focus
description: We have not seen the last of dogfights in the Weltkrieg. Keeping ahead in the development of fighter planes will give us an edge in the future.

name: Bomber Focus
description: When people of the future speak of the horror to today's wars, fire raining from the skies will prominently feature. We will do our best to ensure those stories are told by our enemies.

name: German Air Designs
description: It is no secret that our aircraft technology is lagging behind other Great Powers. We must obtain aircraft blueprints and technical expertise from German companies if we are to catch up with modern aviation technology.

name: The Ottoman Navy
description: The expansion and modernisation of our navy should be a priority. Assign all available resources to new Dockyards and research into light surface ships.

name: Establish the Gölcük Dockyards
description: Our old shipyards located in the Golden Horn are not suitable for building modern capital ships. A survey by our Bahriye engineers has determined that Gölcük is better situated to be our navy's main base and shipyard.

name: Cruiser Effort
description: Before making forays into advanced battleship research, the smaller cruisers are in need of replacement.

name: Battleship Effort
description: The nation with the most battleships will rule the seas. We should not rely on ships purchased from other powers, but acquire the capacity to build our own capital ships.

name: Destroyer Effort
description: Our studies on the strategic use of submarines clearly shows the need to make preparations to counter those strategies. Destroyers will be crucial for this.

name: Submarine Effort
description: Submarine warfare is the most exciting naval development since the invention of the torpedo boat. We would do well to not just protect against submarines, but also use them against enemy shipping.

name: Seek Naval Supremacy
description: Adapting our naval doctrines to accommodate large ships and ensuring the safety of our trade convoys will grant us better control of the seas around our Empire.

name: Marmara and Black Sea
description: Renovating the ancient fortifications on the Dardanelles and Bosphorus straits will ensure the safety of our navy. It will also enable us to maintain a stronger grip on Black Sea shipping routes.

name: Eastern Mediterranean
description: Expanding our naval base in Beirut is crucial if we want to keep the Eastern Mediterranean sea under our control. These plans also include provisions for turning Cyprus into an unsinkable aircraft carrier.

name: Gulf of Basra
description: The port of Basra is crucial for our oil trade, and yet it is under threat from the hostile powers in Persia and Arabia. We must seek to strengthen our naval power in the region to counter these potential threats.
